title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Specta to invest ₹250 cr to nearly treble production capacity
Aimtron Electronics raises ₹100 crore via warrants, plans greenfield facility
India's trade deficit narrows to $18.78 billion in June
items.summary:
- India's trade deficit decreased to *$18.78 billion* in June, down from *$21.88 billion* in May.
- Exports remained nearly flat at *$35.14 billion*, while imports declined by *3.71%*.
- The government aims for a *$1 trillion export target* by FY26 amidst ongoing trade talks and *Free Trade Agreements* with the UK and UAE.

items.title: Kaynes Electronics to invest ₹352 crore in Bhopal unit
items.summary:
- Kaynes Electronics will invest ₹352 crore to establish a manufacturing unit in Bhopal under the *MP Semiconductor Policy 2025*.
- The facility at *Badwai IT Park* will create over 1,000 jobs and commence commercial production by mid-2026.
- This unit marks Kaynes' first significant investment in Central India, bolstering the region as an *emerging electronics and semiconductor hub*.

items.title: Make (more) in India: Electronics Manufacturing Growth
items.summary:
- India is expanding local production of *niche electronics* like **robotic vacuum cleaners** and **air fryers**, aiming to reduce dependence on imports.
- The initiative is driven by *Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS)* certification requirements, fostering a business opportunity estimated over Rs 12,000 crore.
- Companies are exploring local sourcing amid increasing demands for quality control and market growth, even in smaller segments.

items.title: Involve Your Suppliers from Day One
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- *Farrokh N Cooper*, CMD of Cooper Corporation, emphasizes the importance of involving suppliers from the initial stage of R&D to foster synergy and collaboration. 
- He advocates for a mindset shift from being mere *components suppliers* to manufacturers of integrated products, reflecting a journey from engine components to tractors. 
- Cooper believes in leveraging *automation and AI* for operational efficiency and maintaining India's status as a manufacturing hub by adhering to disciplined innovation.

items.title: Nagpur Metro's solar energy expansion gains momentum
items.summary:
- Nagpur Metro's solar energy expansion has stalled, but recent MERC directives are facilitating progress. 
- The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company is mandated to upgrade its net metering approval process, allowing solar capacity beyond 1MW. 
- The project aims for 50% of energy needs from solar, potentially saving ₹45 lakh monthly while transitioning from reliance on costly grid electricity.

items.title: Vanya Steels to set up 10 MW waste-to-energy plant at ₹100 cr investment in Karnataka
Engine received for indigenous Tejas Mark-1A, production set to accelerate
Fadnavis Invites Tesla to Manufacture in Maharashtra
items.author: Shally Mohile, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **Devendra Fadnavis**, Maharashtra's CM, encourages *Tesla* to establish its manufacturing and R&D in the state as it enters the Indian market.
- Fadnavis highlights Maharashtra's **progressive EV policies** and incentives that support electric mobility.
- The move to *Make in Maharashtra* aims to solidify India's position in the EV sector, with expectations that Tesla will innovate locally.

items.title: India's Renewable Energy Capacity Growth in June 2025
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- India added *7.3 GW* of renewable capacity in June 2025, a *420% YoY increase*.
- Significant *4,000% growth* in solar capacity since 2014, alongside a *140% rise* in wind capacity.
- Foreign direct investment in clean energy surpassed *₹1.6 lakh crore* ($20 billion), with promising returns for investors.

items.title: Aurobindo to Supply Long Acting HIV Treatment
items.summary:
- *Aurobindo Pharma* will manufacture long-acting injectable HIV treatments for 133 countries under a new agreement with *ViiV Healthcare* and the *Medicines Patent Pool*.
- This injectable treatment, including *cabotegravir*, offers an alternative to daily medications, with injections required every one or two months.
- The initiative aims to increase access to these vital treatments in low and middle-income countries (LMICs) and aligns with recent WHO guidelines.

items.title: Aurobindo to Supply Long-Acting HIV Treatment
items.summary:
- *Aurobindo Pharma* will produce and distribute **cabotegravir** injections in 133 countries, transforming HIV treatment options.
- This collaboration with **Medicines Patent Pool** and **ViiV Healthcare** allows patients to switch from daily pills to a long-lasting injection every one to two months.
- The move aims to increase access to this treatment in **low and middle-income markets**, supporting global health initiatives.

items.title: US Factories Face Slowdown Despite Years of Support
items.author: TOI Business Desk
items.summary:
- US manufacturing shows signs of stagnation despite *political support* from both Trump and Biden administrations. 
- Factors such as *inflation*, *interest rate hikes*, and *tariff uncertainties* are contributing to job losses and weak production. 
- With ongoing policy *flip-flops* and demand weakness, factories are hesitant to invest and hire, awaiting clearer economic signals.

items.title: Drone Warfare: India's Strategic Shift
items.author: Sarahbeth George, ET Online
items.summary:
* *Operation Sindoor* demonstrates India’s evolving drone capabilities and signifies a shift in modern warfare towards preparation over reaction.  
* Garuda Aerospace, transitioning from agri-tech to defense, focuses on versatile, multi-role drones to fill gaps in India’s defense sector.  
* With a commitment to indigenous production, Garuda aims to reduce dependence on imports, ensuring that India is better equipped for future conflicts.

items.title: MKU secures major multi-year ballistic helmet contract in Asia
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *MKU* has received a pivotal contract to supply over **200,000 advanced ballistic helmets** to a leading Asian armed force.
- The *Kavro helmets*, meeting **NIJ Level IIIA standards**, were chosen following a competitive evaluation against top manufacturers.
- This contract bolsters India’s *defence manufacturing capabilities* and supports the **Make in India** initiative.

items.title: US Tariffs Present Trade Opportunities for India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Higher US tariffs* on key trading partners could benefit India's *automobile*, *electronics*, and *machinery sectors*.
- NITI Aayog reports that India could gain *competitiveness* in many product categories, especially automotive-related goods.
- Ongoing trade discussions aim to optimize access and explore a *services-focused trade deal* with the US.

items.title: Importers delay customs clearance of US dry fruit
items.author: Jayashree Bhosale, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Indian dry fruit importers are delaying *customs clearance* of US nuts, hoping for reductions in import duties due to a potential trade deal. 
- This delay may exacerbate existing *supply disruptions*, particularly with halted Afghan imports. 
- The industry anticipates that duties on *walnuts* and *almonds* could be halved as part of the trade negotiations.

items.title: Govt may not extend ISTS charges waiver for solar and wind projects
items.summary:
- The Indian government plans to end the *ISTS charges waiver* for solar and wind projects, likely raising *power tariffs*.
- Industry groups, like EPTA, express concern over significant investment risks tied to project delays.
- Projects facing delays due to land issues and environmental concerns may receive *case-by-case relief* but overall competitiveness of renewables is threatened.

items.title: India’s new copper import rules could trigger supply crunch, warns trade body
Campa Goes Global: Soft Drink Launch in Nepal
items.summary:
- *Reliance Consumer Products Ltd* has launched its *Campa Cola* brand in *Nepal*, partnering with the local *Chaudhary Group* for manufacturing and distribution.
- The product range includes *Campa Lemon*, *Campa Orange*, and *Campa Energy Gold Boost*, aiming to tap into the local beverage market.
- This entry underscores Reliance's commitment to growth in the region, enhancing their competitive presence following launches in the Middle East.

items.title: India to Surpass Japan as 4th Largest Economy
items.summary:
- India is projected to become the *fourth-largest economy* in 2025, surpassing Japan.
- Japan faces economic challenges, including *25% US tariffs* and sluggish growth, impacting its automotive sector.
- *Bilateral trade* between India and Japan is growing, with a focus on automobiles, semiconductors, and infrastructure.

items.title: Taiwanese, Vietnamese Firms Eye India Footwear Sector
items.summary:
- Taiwanese and Vietnamese companies are eager to invest in India's *non-leather footwear sector*. 
- A trade pact with the US could significantly boost exports, targeting USD 7 billion by 2025-26. 
- States like *Uttar Pradesh* and *Bihar* present great investment opportunities due to their affordable labor force.

items.title: Bihar's New Renewable Energy Policy
items.summary:
- Bihar's new *renewable energy policy* aims to attract ₹1.5 lakh crore in investments and generate **125,000 jobs**.
- The policy targets 23.96 GW of renewable energy by FY 2029-30, enhancing energy storage capacity.
- It includes incentives like *100% reimbursement* of SGST and land fees, making Bihar an attractive destination for *renewable energy investment*.

items.title: CBAM may cost Indian steel exporters €551 million by 2034: Report
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The *Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism* (CBAM) could impose costs on Indian steel exporters totaling **€551 million** by 2034.
- Indian steel products, especially flat-rolled iron and steel, are likely to bear the brunt of these financial implications as the EU enforces stricter climate rules.
- To mitigate the impact, a *coordinated approach* between Indian and EU stakeholders is necessary for a sustainable transition to cleaner manufacturing practices.

items.title: MP CM Mohan Yadav discusses 3.0 GW solar project
items.summary:
- Chief Minister **Mohan Yadav** and Grew Energy CEO **Vinay Thadani** met in Dubai to discuss a *3.0 GW solar project* in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram district.
- This initiative is projected to create over *700 jobs* and enhance the state's position in the *sustainable energy sector*.
- The project aims to attract foreign investments, with Thadani highlighting a commitment of *Rs 3,000 crore*, potentially rising to *Rs 10,000 crores*.

items.title: Moglix enters energy sector with new bitumen facility in Mathura
Monolithisch India expands installed capacity to 156,000 TPA
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Monolithisch India has increased its manufacturing capacity from 132,000 TPA to **156,000 TPA**, marking an **18% increase**.  
- This expansion is part of a phased strategy with **long-term goals** set at **574,000 TPA** by upgrading infrastructure and processes.  
- Planned future targets include **215,000 TPA** by September 15 and **250,000 TPA** by December 31, 2025.

items.title: Sun Pharma to invest ₹3,800 crore in Madhya Pradesh
items.summary:
- *Sun Pharma* plans to invest ₹3,800 crore in Madhya Pradesh, aiming to create **2,000 jobs**.
- The investment is part of a larger effort to attract **₹12,473 crore** across various sectors during the Madhya Pradesh Growth Conclave.
- Chief Minister **Mohan Yadav** emphasized the government's commitment to boosting *employment opportunities* in the state with incentives for multiple industries.

items.title: KSH Infra to invest ₹550 crore in second industrial park in Tamil Nadu
Redington-Eastern Auto & Power Tie-Up for Solar Components
items.summary:
- The partnership aims to enhance the supply of *Made-in-India solar components* for rooftop and ground-mounted projects, including the PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana. 
- Redington will utilize Eastman Auto's products to meet subsidy criteria and expand its product portfolio for solar solutions. 
- Both companies are focused on increasing access to *solar energy solutions* across residential, commercial, and industrial sectors in India.

items.title: SAEL's $954 Million Solar Manufacturing Investment
items.summary:
- *SAEL Industries Ltd* plans to invest **$954 million** in a solar manufacturing plant in *Uttar Pradesh*, increasing production capacity to 8.5 GW.  
- Construction is set to begin in 2025, aligning with India's strategy to localize solar manufacturing.  
- The company's revenue from biomass and power production aims to grow significantly by fiscal 2027.

items.title: US Manufacturers Struggle Despite Government Support
items.summary:
- Despite government *subsidies* under Biden and *tariffs* from Trump, **US manufacturing** is experiencing ongoing stagnation.
- Job losses and declining manufacturing activity have persisted for nearly three years, raising concerns about a potential recession.
- Experts predict that this uncertain economic landscape will likely lead to continued hesitancy in hiring and investment decisions among manufacturers.

items.title: PM Modi's ₹1 Lakh Crore Job Initiative
items.author: Mahima Jain
items.summary:
- PM Modi launched a scheme aiming to create **3.5 crore** jobs in the private sector through the Employment Linked Incentive Scheme.
- The Rozgar Mela distributed **over 51,000** appointment letters, underlining the government's focus on job creation and **women empowerment** initiatives.
- Modi emphasized India's strengths in *demography* and *democracy* as key drivers for economic growth and poverty alleviation.

items.title: The stagnation trap - How Indian MSMEs can break free & scale
Telangana Deputy CM to re-launch Pranahita-Chevella project, boost support for women-led micro-industries
Eazy Business Solutions Bets on Homegrown ERP
items.summary:
- *Eazy Business Solutions*, founded in 2007, addresses the disconnect in Indian SMEs by integrating ERP with Tally for streamlined operations.
- Their focus on local business practices and modular solutions allows manufacturers to unify processes and maintain financial accuracy.
- Currently expanding into international markets like Africa and the Middle East, the company aims to meet growing demands for scalable software in manufacturing sectors.

items.title: Commerce & Industry Ministry Pushes Exports and Projects
items.summary:
- **Union Minister Piyush Goyal** has been actively traveling from Srinagar to Bengaluru, focusing on enhancing *exports* and *industrial projects*.  
- Key meetings included discussions on *export credit* options to aid **MSME exporters** and ensuring regional concerns are considered during *FTA* negotiations.  
- A significant review addressed *infrastructure projects* in Gujarat and Rajasthan, fast-tracking investments exceeding **Rs 36,296 crore**.

items.title: Tata Steel's £1.25 Billion Electric Arc Furnace Construction
items.summary:
- Tata Steel UK is constructing a **£1.25 billion Electric Arc Furnace** in Port Talbot to reduce carbon emissions by *5 million tonnes annually*.
- The project, supported by a *£500 million investment* from the UK government, aims to produce **3 million tonnes of steel** per year from UK-sourced scrap.
- This initiative marks a significant step in Tata Steel's *decarbonisation strategy* and a commitment to sustainable manufacturing in the UK.

items.title: Dentons Link Legal guides Skoda on railway manufacturing JV
items.author: Online Bureau
items.summary:
- **Dentons Link Legal** advised Skoda on a 50:50 joint venture with Tata AutoComp for railway component manufacturing in India.
- The venture aims to produce high-technology products, supporting India's *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* initiatives.
- Legal aspects were managed effectively by the Dentons team, showcasing their expertise in cross-border joint ventures.

items.title: India's Exports: Growth Potential Amid Tariff Changes
items.summary:
- India can increase its exports significantly despite potential 10% tariffs from the US. 
- Key sectors like *chemicals*, *apparel*, and *agriculture* present major growth opportunities. 
- Strategic policy support will enable India to leverage shifts in global trade dynamics.

items.title: TN Yarn Manufacturers Form Association Amid Rising Costs
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- Yarn manufacturers in Tirupur, Tamil Nadu, have established the *Tirupur Yarn Manufacturers Association* to tackle *rising production costs* and payment delays.
- The industry has been under stress for five years, impacted by *surging cotton prices* and soaring electricity tariffs.
- The association aims to create a *unified platform* for addressing concerns and engaging with policymakers to sustain the textile manufacturing ecosystem.

items.title: NLC India to invest ₹1.25 lakh crore by 2030, targets 20 GW capacity with green focus
items.summary:
- NLC India plans to invest *₹1.25 lakh crore* by 2030 to increase its capacity from 6.7 GW to **20 GW**.  
- Approximately *₹65,000 crore* is allocated for *renewables*, with a focus on a **battery storage system**.  
- The investment will also support *thermal energy* and international mining ventures to secure **critical minerals**.

items.title: India Seeks Private Investment in Rare Earth Magnet Production
items.summary:
- The Indian government is promoting *private players* for rare earth permanent magnet production to reduce reliance on *China*.  
- New *Production Linked Incentive (PLI) schemes* have been launched to encourage domestic manufacturing and participation.  
- India aims to establish a sustainable supply chain using locally developed technology to ensure a steady supply of *critical minerals*.

items.title: Smaller e-bike cos slip after FAME red flag
Phonemakers Brace for PLI Impact
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, Kiran Rathee
items.summary:
- The *Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)* scheme for mobile phones is ending, creating uncertainty for manufacturers. 
- Industry experts predict increased competition and pressure on operating margins after the PLI ends. 
- Indian manufacturers are urging for an extension or a new initiative ('PLI 2.0') to maintain competitiveness against global players.

items.title: US Copper Tariff May Impact Indian Electronics, Chip Plans
items.author: Suraksha P
items.summary:
- The *50% US copper tariff* raises concerns for India's electronics and semiconductor sectors, as it relies heavily on imported high-purity copper materials.
- Industry leaders urge the Indian government to enhance *domestic production* of copper and streamline import processes to avoid disruptions.
- There is a risk that these tariffs could slow India's semiconductor momentum by increasing costs and hindering foreign investment in the sector.

items.title: India Aims for 2030 Aluminium Goals with Accelerated Bauxite Production and Mining Approvals
Electronics and Pharma Corner 70% of FY25 PLI Disbursements
items.summary:
- In FY25, **70%** of India's ₹10,114 crore PLI disbursements were awarded to *electronics* and *pharmaceuticals*. 
- The electronics sector received **₹5,732 crore**, with a notable **32.46%** increase in exports, totaling *$38.58 billion*. 
- The PLI scheme aims to enhance *domestic manufacturing* across various sectors, including *bulk drugs* and *medical devices*.

items.title: Cipla Gears up to Enter Obesity Drug Market
items.author: Press Trust of India
items.summary:
- Cipla is *entering* India's weight management segment to address the obesity epidemic.
- The company is focusing on *differentiated therapies* and in-licensing CNS products.
- Major competitors like *Eli Lilly* and *Novo Nordisk* have already introduced anti-obesity treatments in the market.
